edu.cs.hm.cb.compiler.scanner
Class State

java.lang.Object
  edu.cs.hm.cb.compiler.scanner.State
All Implemented Interfaces:
IState
public class State
extends java.lang.Object
implements IState

Represents a state in the dfa and holds it's data like the transition to the next state(s).

Author:
Manuel Schaechinger

Method Detail

get

public static State get(int id)
Looks up if an existing state has already this id and returns it, otherwise creates a new one.

Parameters:
id - the unique id to determine if there is an existing state
Returns:
the state that was created or returned from the existing one

get

public static State get(java.lang.String id)
Parses the id in string form to an integer and calls the getInstance (int) method.

Parameters:

Returns:
the state that was created or returned from the existing one

addSymbol

public boolean addSymbol(ISymbol symbol,
                         IState to)
Adds a new symbol to the list of symbols that with that this state can be reached.

Parameters:
symbol - the symbol with that this state can be reached
Returns:
if the symbol was added or not (if it was already there)

getChild

public State getChild(ISymbol symbol)
Checks if there is a state that can be reached with the defined state.

Parameters:
symbol - the symbol that should cause the transformation to the next state
Returns:
the state if there is one, otherwise null

getParent

public State getParent()
Returns the first parent state that is not equals to this one.

Returns:
the predecessor of this state

addParent

public void addParent(State parent)
Adds a parent state to this state.

Parameters:
parent - the state that is a predecessor of this one

public int getId()
Returns the unique id of this state.

isFinal

public boolean isFinal()
Returns if this state is final and therefore indicates a token.

Specified by:

setFinal

public void setFinal(java.lang.String tokenName,
                     boolean variable,
                     boolean pass)
Set the state to final and indicate that a token is found when you reach this state.

Specified by:
setFinal in interface IState
Parameters:
tokenName - the name of the tokenClass that identifies it
pass - indicates if the tokenClass should be passed to the parser
variable - indicates if the tokenClass has a variable structure

getTokenClass

public ITokenClass getTokenClass()
Returns the tokenclass if this state is final.
